verses.name: Job 40:14
verses.text: Then will I also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can save thee.

verses.name: Job 40:15
verses.text: Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox.

verses.name: Job 40:16
verses.text: Lo now, his strength is in his loins, and his force is in the navel of his belly.

verses.name: Job 40:17
verses.text: He moveth his tail like a cedar: the sinews of his stones are wrapped together.

verses.name: Job 40:18
verses.text: His bones are as strong pieces of brass; his bones are like bars of iron.

verses.name: Job 40:19
verses.text: He is the chief of the ways of God: he that made him can make his sword to approach unto him.
